resp.text: We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. It's experiences like yours that really keep us motivated! If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help

name: Asia Brannon
text: The staff was wonderful! Dr Thompson and his nurse Angela were so helpful and kind and made us feel welcome.

resp.text: Asia, we're glad to hear you enjoyed your visit. We look forward to your next visit! Take care!

name: Candace Devine
text: Y'all were so sweet and took care of my little girl as if she were your own! Best customer service in this area by far! Thank y'all so much for everything y'all do for your patients!

resp.text: Candace Devine, we're so glad that we were able to go above and beyond your expectations! We do hope we can be of assistance in the future. Take care!

name: Lindsay Morrison
text: It was an u expected visit. Everyone was super helpful they even helped me choose a pharmacy since we were from out of town. Definitely recommend them!

resp.text: Lindsay Morrison, we're so glad that we were able to go above and beyond your expectations!

name: Patricia Donovan
text: I went there very ill and it is close to my house.  After an hour I ask how much longer and find out that she hasn't even put my paperwork in the computer yet and it could be another hour.  They don't do triage. .. I find that inexcusable for supposed Urgent Care!   I could barely sit up any longer or walk so I left.  Apparently if you've been there before you get a free ride to the back and newbies have to wait for an incompetent receptionist to get around to them.

resp.text: Hi Patricia Donovan, thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent experience. We are disappointed to hear that you are not satisfied with your visit. We would like to have a better understanding about your experience. Please reach out to us at (334) 677-6001 at your earliest convenience and we will do our best to resolve this with you.

name: Margaret Jackson
text: I have brought my daughter here several times. They always provide great service. Will recommend this clinic to all my friends and family.

resp.text: Kendra Jackson, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We always love to receive great feedback.

name: Christi Wood
text: Feeling like I had been hit by a truck, I decided it was time to let a doctor diagnose and medicate me.  My husband suggested we go to AFC so we went.  The doctor was very attentive and went so far as to make sure I had an excuse for work which, being sick, I didn't even think about.  Doctor knew what he was talking about because I feel 110% better since my appt yesterday!  Thanks AFC!

resp.text: Christi Wood, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We are glad to hear that you had a positive experience!

name: Wendy Parker
text: I had to take my husband into the office this past Saturday. As always it was a easy check in & a short wait. The staff is wonderful & Dr Thompson took  the time to listen to what was going on with my husband. American Family Care is the only walk in clinic that we will use.

name: Danny McDuffie
text: Convenient

name: Jay DoubleU
text: Not very impressed with the facility. The receptionist was lacking in the personality department. The nurse was actually very good at his job. As for the Dr. Not very professional. talked to me more about voting for our next president, than what was going on with me. All in all it felt like I was giving money to a charity, without the feeling of doing something good, because I truly received no care. The total office visit lasted  nearly 3 hours.

name: Paul DeBeer
text: Fast, professional care.  Very informative.

resp.text: We can't wait to see you again, have a great day.

name: Daltrey Fryer
text: The staff was great and the doctor was great they really make you feel at home and welcomed there. I would definitely recommend this facility to other people.

resp.text: Daltrey we are so pleased you enjoyed your visit to American Family Care - Dothan! Thanks again for the recommendation, and have an amazing day!

name: Edward Cook
text: Be aware, there is a doctor there ONLY mom-thurs.

resp.text:
Thank you Mr. Cook for your review.  We strive to provide quality service to all of our patients.  You may call the clinic to insure that there is a medical doctor on staff that day if necessary.  Our nurse practitioners can also see a very wide range of medical issues.  Thank you again and we hope to see you again in the future.
Cindy Dumas-Director

name: Catherine Cole
text: If I could give minus stars I would! At the start the blonde receptionist should not be greeting people she has a bad attitude definitely not a customer service people person! Makes you feel like you’re bothering her. Secondly I was there two hours waiting just to get approval to see a Dr. nothing my office or headquarters or Workman’s comp Ins sent was good enough. I finally said should I go to PrimeCare? Because my manager said we never had all this problem there. She says “ yeah you should”! I was like wow! Ok ! Thank you very much! And walked out! Went to PrimeCare they had me approved and waiting in the Dr room in 5 min and very sweet!!! GO TO PRIMCARE NOT THIS PLACE!!! Horrible service horrible attitude not professional at all!

resp.text: We regret to hear that you had a negative experience with us, but would appreciate the chance to turn your experience around. If you are willing to give us another chance, please reach out to us 334-677-6001 to speak to our manager directly.

name: James Lanley
text: Wait time was not long. Receptionist, RN, and the Doc “Cowboy” were excellent. I’d highly recommend going there if you need care. -

resp.text: James, we are so pleased you enjoyed your visit to American Family Care - Dothan! If you're ever in need of more help, please let us know!

name: Bernie Alexander
text: With the exception of having to wait almost as long in a hospital waiting room the overall experience was over the top.  The greeting was very professional and the concern that was given to. My personal need make you want to firgef about the hospital ER and go back here..

resp.text: Hi Bernie, we are very happy to have provided you with such a positive experience! We do hope we can be of assistance in the future. Take care!

name: Mrs Richardson
text: Everyone was nice and had good attitudes for having to work on Labor Day.  We were there a reasonable amount of time.

resp.text: Hi Mrs Richardson, we are very happy to have provided you with such a positive experience! Please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you; we are more than happy to help!

name: Elizabeth Peavey
text: Went to see Dr. Abby about 3 weeks ago. I was very happy with the care I received while I was there but the after care likes much improvement. The specialist I was referred to was given the wrong information and because of that I now have to wait until March of 2018.The problem I having keeps me in a lot of pain so I called back today to talk to someone about medication to help me and I was rudely told you will have to wait until you see the specialist. So wow thanks for nothing. I guess if  I get where I can't walk thats ok too.

resp.text: Elizabeth, we regret to hear that you had this experience with us. Falling short of meeting your expectations is not to the standards we strive to achieve, and we humbly ask for the opportunity to make this right. Thank you providing this information so we can improve upon our services. We hope to hear from you soon.  American Family Care - Dothan

name: Robin Bundy
text: Took my daughter to find out about some leg pain she was having.   They did X-rays and then scheduled her for other testing at hospital.   We haven’t heard anything about the results, so I called.   They “can’t” give me the results over the phone.  They “can’t” mail us the results.  So now, I have to go pick them up at the office.  My daughter will be in pain a total of 16 days (at least, because she never tells me stuff right away) before we will be able to find out why she is having the pain and inability to put weight on her leg.  REALLY???  I do not recommend going here if you want the people who ordered your tests to do their job and let you know the results!!

resp.text: Robin Bundy, we regret to hear that you had a negative experience with us, but would appreciate the chance to turn your experience around. Thanks for bringing this matter to our attention. We would like to get more details about this; please reach out to us at your earliest convenience at (334) 677-6001.

name: Stacy Johnston
text: The Staff and Doctors are all courteous, professional and very thorough in their assessments. We go for Preventive care, PPP, and "no need for ER" boo boos. Extra points fo ALWAYS having a very clean and tastefully decorated waiting area which makes you NOT dread going to the doctor's office.👍👍

resp.text: Hello Stacy, thank you; we appreciate your feedback! Please don't hesitate to reach out if there's anything additional we can do for you.

name: Jennifer Riffee
text: I walked in on a Sunday to sign in. First thing out of the woman's mouth, 'We have a 3.5 to 4 hour wait' that was my greeting. Six people in the waiting room. I chose not to stay but because that is insane.

resp.text: Jennifer, we pride ourselves on providing exceptional service, so we are disappointed to hear that your visit with us was anything less than satisfactory. Please reach out to us at (334) 677-6001 so we may assist you in moving forward towards a resolution.

name: Andrea Bergman
text: Thought I had exceptional care.

resp.text: If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

name: Amber Jowers
text: Front desk was extremely slow about getting people check in. I waiting in the long area 43 minutes before she called me up for my copay and checked me in. But the back half was amazing. I was very sick and vomiting unable to drive and they called my husband to come get me. Put my in a room kept check on me and making sure I was ok until my husband got there to get me. They were more worried about my wellbeing then to just let me drive out and get in a wreck or something worse. To me that is everything and I would recommend this office to anyone, they are wonderful people who care.

resp.text: Amber, we are so pleased you enjoyed your visit to American Family Care - Dothan! If you're ever in need of more help, please let us know!

name: Judy Crowe
text: Great staff. I've never waited long.

resp.text: If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

name: MHatcher
text: Went to this place because I was having severe pain on my right side. They did tests and an x-ray guessing it may be my gallbladder. Said they were gonna make me an appointment for an ultrasound the next day, they made one and the appointment isn’t until 4 days later. Called back asking if they can prescribe something for pain to hold me until the ultrasound. Their reply was go to the ER. If you plan on coming here for anything other than a cold you’re better off just heading to the ER because that’s what they are gonna tell you. They expect you to spend thousands on an ER visits instead of actually listening to the patient. I’ve never taken anything beyond ibuprofen in my life.

resp.text: Mhatcher, thank you for leaving us feedback. We are disappointed to hear that your experience was not a positive one. We appreciate you bringing this experience to our attention. If you are willing, please contact us at (334) 677-6001 so we can work towards a resolution. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Kasey Woodham
text: Awful experience. Don’t recommend using this place.

resp.text: We would like the chance to turn your experience around. If you are willing to give us another chance, please reach out to us at 334-677-6001 to speak to our manager directly.

name: Bett
text: 10 + The staff was very helpful and friendly and Dr Thompson actually listened to me and had a genuine concern for my health. I will definitely visit again.

resp.text: Alan, we really appreciate your positive review! We can't wait to see you again, have a great day.

name: Ashli Hancock
text: Love how my son can be seen when the regular doctor is closed.  We were even able to get his vacancies update.

resp.text: Ashli Hancock, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback.

name: Lisa Green
text: Very nice and helpful staff, doctor's treatment helped me feel better and on my way to getting well!

resp.text: Lisa, we are glad we could help! We can't wait to see you again, have a great day.

name: Danny Shute
text: Fast in and out. Very caring and friendly group of people.

resp.text: Danny, we are so happy to read such a great review about American Family Care - Dothan! We hope to be of service to you again in the future.  Best wishes,  American Family Care - Dothan

name: Roger Sasser
text: Everyone was so nice! From the receptionist x-ray tect. to the Doctor!  Very professional! Answered all my questions. Thank you so much! This was my first visit. But not my last!

name: Rachel Ivy
text: Waited for at least 30 minutes after vitals were taken before someone came to see me, but the real issue I had was their sending my prescription to the wrong pharmacy. Not only did they send it to the wrong pharmacy, but they told ME to call my pharmacy and the pharmacy they’d sent it to to fix their mistake. I did, but the pharmacy they’d sent it to was already closed. I called the office back to ask them to just fax it to my actual pharmacy, but, by that time, their office had already closed.

resp.text: We are disappointed to hear that you did not have a more positive experience with us at American Family Care - Dothan. Thanks for bringing this matter to our attention. We would like to get more details about this; please reach out to us at your earliest convenience at (334) 677-6001.

name: Bart Norton
text: I always pleased with the level of care I receive. They also follow up with to see how you are doing.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

name: Stephanie MacKenzie
text: My boyfriend just left here.  He specifically asked before paying and waiting if they would be able to help with his eye problem or if he should go to the ER.  He explained what was going on and what he had already done for it.  The girl at the front told him that they could help him here.  The doctor looked at his eye, gave no diagnosis, and told him to go to the ER.  Now we are out $175 with no resolution.  We could have used that money to go to the ER in the first place if the girl at the front had been more honest instead of just wanting to take our money.  What a waste.  The only reason I have one extra star is because the wait time that he was quoted was actually about right, even though it was still 3 hours.

resp.text: Greetings. We appreciate your feedback, and welcome the opportunity to address all concerns. I am the patient advocate, and I can be reached at (205) 403-8902.. Thank you for allowing us to learn from you. Stay well.

name: Brenda Sikes
text: I am well pleased with the treatment I received at American Family Care. The staff were professional and efficient. I would recommend AFC to anyone needing medical services

resp.text: Brenda, reviews like this give us motivation and help us ensure we provide high-quality care. Please don't hesitate to reach out to us if there's anything more we can do!

name: Cody Tarter
text: Very positive experience. Friendly folks. Will definitely come back for urgent care needs.

resp.text: Cody , reviews like this give us motivation and help us ensure we provide high-quality care. Thank you, and have a fantastic day!

name: Brenna O'Connor
text: My visit was great. I came in for vaccinations for school and it was a very pleasant exprience. Dr. Thompson and the entire staff was great.

resp.text: Thank you, Brenna O'Connor, for reaching out to us. Your opinion plays an integral part in our customer service. We always love to receive great feedback.

name: Marcia Bryant
text: I went into the facility and upon signing in the receptionist stated the wait will be 1 hour and 20 minutes, with only two people waiting before me. As much pain as I was in, I waited because the emergency room would have possibly been a longer wait. I went in because of severe chest pains and back pains. Needless to say I was prescribed a medication for stomach ulcers. And given a long speech about drinking soda, keeps him making money. Left still in pain and know understanding of why my chest has been hurting for a week, I will never go there again.

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback, and welcome the opportunity to address all concerns. I am the patient advocate, and I can be reached at (205) 403-8902. You can also submit concerns via a secure satisfaction survey at www.americanfamilycare.com. Thank you for allowing us to learn from you. Stay well.

name: Carsina Burks
text: Thank you so much for being attentive, kind and meeting my needs. I'm already feeling better.

resp.text: Carsina , we strive for 100% satisfaction, and it is great to see you had such a positive experience at American Family Care - Dothan. We hope to be of service to you again in the future.  Best wishes,  American Family Care - Dothan

name: kadijah moss
text: Wow very impressed! They got me in and out and the prescription that was prescribed has me feeling a lot better just a day later!

resp.text: Kadijah, we're so glad that we were able to go above and beyond your expectations! If you have any further questions, please give us a call. We're always happy to help!

name: Krystal Parrish
text: Was seen by Dr Thompson 2 days ago, and had my blood drawn. The doctor actually spent time with me discussing my symptoms and problems I was having. Very good place to get the care you deserve.

resp.text: Thanks Krystal, for leaving us this response. We always love to receive great feedback.

text: Very courteous and knowledgeable staff! Their hours are extremely helpful!

resp.text: Becky, we are so pleased you enjoyed your visit to American Family Care - Dothan! Please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you; we are more than happy to help!

name: Jonathan Noble
text: Staff is friendly and professional, and the facility clean. If you have a fairly simple, straightforward problem or difficulty, then AFC might be the place to go (although the upfront cost is $175).  My own experience, however, was less than satisfying. For a total of $225 over two visits, I had six vials of blood taken and a review of the results but without any real treatment of my ailments. The physician who saw me to review my blood test results (for $50) basically told me to take fish oil and would not even consider a refill on the prescription the first physician had given, much less any other medication and/or treatment for my ailments. All in all, then, I have to say I was/am dissatisfied. (Also, their feedback form does not come up when clicked on, soooo you cannot provide feedback directly to AFC!)

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback, and welcome the opportunity to address all concerns. I am the patient advocate, and I can be reached at (205) 403-8902.. Thank you for allowing us to learn from you. Stay well.

text: I came in very sick. The staff was very friendly and the Doctor has great bedside manner and really care about your health.

text: It should say we don’t see patients after a certain time. On the door it says they close at 6. We got there 10 min before closing which I know is cutting it close. But if you close at a certain time you should see patients until that time. Lock the door at 6 so no one else can come in. So irritated. 😡

resp.text: Kimberly, we regret to hear that you had this experience with us. It is discouraging to learn of your experience with us. Your feedback helps us improve and we would like to learn more about how we can make this better.

name: ChiLover !
text: My husband went in to get his BP medication refilled because we moved here from out of state and do not have a Dr here. They charged him $150 for that and that is all they did. He was told when he had to go back that it would only be $50 if it was just for his medicine refill and nothing else ( and this is a med he has been taking for about 7 years and he can't go without it). But when he went back they charged him $175 (even more than the first visit). He is on SSDI and doesn't receive Medicare yet so he has to pay cash! I think this is ridiculous to charge that much just to get a medication refill and not have anything else done! You would think they could have a little compassion on someone that is disabled and living just off Social Security and has low income! And the visit only took the time it took for the Dr to write it out! Actually he probably could have just seen the nurse for that!

resp.text: Mary Flanagan, thank you for leaving us feedback. We are disappointed to hear that your experience was not a positive one. We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Please reach out to use directly at (334) 677-6001 when you have a chance. Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you.

name: Samantha Johnson
text: I went in for common sinus issues, knew I needed a shot or Zpack and cough meds my horrible cough. They prescribed me cough meds that wasn't working. AFC called me the DAY AFTER to check on me. I informed them the cough meds weren't working. The receptionist told me to hold and she would check on it for me. Well couple min later she tells me she can't have another doctor prescribe me anything bc the doctor I had saw yesterday wasn't in until Wednesday the next week. I was informed I would have to come in and see a different doctor and pay another co-pay. I called again today to see if they could speak with his nurse  to see if I could get anything done. NOTHING they didn't offer anything other than come in pay again and see another doctor. So I have to spend more money and time I don't have for something that is a simple fix. This is my first and last time ever using a AFC.. On the plus side Dr. Thompson was great I just wish they wouldn't have called to check on me they aren't going to do anything to help.

resp.text: Good morning. I am the patient advocate. The experience you depict does not meet the service expectations American Family Care has set. Please connect with me at your convenience to discuss your concerns further. I can be reached at (205) 403-8902 ext. 2269. Thank you for allowing us to learn from y  ou. Stay wel

name: Dwight Gilley
text: Very disappointed In this company. I went in for a physical and was told that the cost would be $50 for the service. I was ok with that being as how I paid for the service. A couple of weeks later I received a bill in the mail for $87. The description of the bill says office visit that is it. No other description on the bill or from a representative. I called and they said they would file a claim for the bill but never herd anything back. AFC you will never get any of my business or any referrals from me. Sending someone a "office visit" bill a few weeks after your original office visit is crooked no matter if it's $87 or $87,000.

resp.text: Dwight Gilley, we regret that you had a negative experience with us, but are glad you brought this to our attention. Our manager would really like to help turn your experience around. If you would be willing to give us another chance, please contact our manager at (334) 677-6001 to discuss what we can do to help.

name: Area 51 Customer Service
text:
Waited for 45 minutes with my wife who had a foot injury (bleeding) only to be told by the nurse "the doctor will not see anyone who is pregnant". This is after calling ahead and telling the lady on the phone that she's pregnant, and then telling the receptionist the same thing while we were checking in.

So If you want to do business with a doctor who refuses treatment to a 10 week pregnant woman with a bleeding toe and a ripped off toenail, this is your place!

text: I’ve been here before and had a decent experience, but on this visit, I was really disappointed.  My daughter was having a number of symptoms, and we wanted her to get tested for COVID, strep, and flu.  We weren’t told until after they’d already done her COVUd and strep tests that they were out of flu tests, so we ended up having to spend the rest of the day at a second clinic.  If they had told me ahead of time, I would have just gone to a different clinic and saved myself two hours, an extra co-pay, and a bunch of unnecessary paperwork.

text: The nurses and doctors were so kind, which is why I gave more than one star. However, I strongly believe you need a new receptionist or that your current one needs a change in her attitude. I’m never coming back again because I prefer to not be treated the way she treated me today.

name: Alexandra Brooke Hoffine
text: Awful. I had a terrible accident to my ankle and the PA Prescribed me Celebrex which the pharmacy wouldn’t even fill bc she (the PA) didn’t complete the paperwork, I called back and asked for her to do so and also continued to reiterate that I was in a lot of pain. She had the intake nurse get on the phone and say “if you’re in so much pain then go to the emergency room”. I work in healthcare myself and can’t fathom treating someone this way. Do yourself a favor and go to UAB. Also their portable Welch Allyn vitals machine was filthy which is pretty foul for an urgent care facility.

resp.text: Hi, Alexandra. We strive to provide an excellent patient care experience and all feedback regarding a visit experience is important to us. Please feel free to consult with our Patient Feedback representative at (225) 214-9352, Option 5 or PatientFeedback@phcurgentcare.com.

name: Akram Syed
text:
Waiting Room: Given the pandemic, the waiting room was full. I was glad that the waiting room seats were clearly demarcated so that nobody sat too close to each other and there was adequate social distancing.

The Wait: even though there were a lot of people in line, it moved relatively fast for a small operation. I think it took me about 45 minutes from walking in the clinic to getting looked at and checked out.

The Staff: the nurse and the PA were cordial, efficient, and fast. They explained whatever tests were being done before they did anything. They also talked about post-discharge care, results, etc.

name: Kristin Landham
text: I was in and out in less than 30 minutes. Very clean environment. Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable.

resp.text: Thanks so much, Kristin! Our goal is to ensure that all of our patients have the best experience every time they visit our office.

name: Natasha Seymour
text:
I had a great experience here and wouldn't hesitate to return. The ladies on the front desk were so friendly and welcoming, and both the doctor and nurse were thorough and took the time to ensure that my questions were answered and my needs met.

The doctor had wonderful bedside manner and seemed to really love her job; I appreciate that she took the time to explain everything (compared to some other doctors who simply write you a script and rush you out the door) and made me feel included in my care.

resp.text: Thanks so much, Bob! Our goal is to ensure that all of our patients have the best experience every time they visit our office.

name: Susan Johnson
text: Excellent care of patients. Dr. Chada is the best. I have seen her several times and she is very professional, friendly, and knowledgeable! I was in and out of there in about 30 minutes on a Saturday morning. I think that’s because they’re not doing Covid tests.

name: Ricky Nova
text: Extremely happy with my visit here, everyone was super kind and answered all questions i had

name: Alesia Ray
text:
I received a phone call a week after the visit with my child stating her test results were negative. I wasn't aware of any tests so they called me back after investigating and said the results were from an opiate test. ???!??!?! On a child? Why? This is strange because we never discussed this test. A Doctor called me back ( not the Dr who saw my daughter) and explained he would never have ran this test without speaking to a parent and that he saw nothing in the chart indicating an opiate test necessary. He also said I deserved an answer for this.
About a half hour went by and Brittany, the office manager called me apologizing for the mistake and said this test never should have been ran. But then she retracted and stated it was protocol when a teenager comes in because "teenagers won't tell the truth when their parents are there with them!" This was so alarming to me. Brittany then made an ignorant statement that since my teenage child had pain in her chest that it was just their protocol to test for opiates!  I explained that ALL ages of human beings can do opiates so protocols shouldn't apply "just" to teenagers. Let's all keep in mind results were NEGATIVE.
Overall, I feel this test was ran to get unnecessary funds from the insurance company and what made it worse was Brittany. She was rude, spoke over me time and time again, got so snippy with me when I was merely trying to understand why this test was ran with no consent on a MINOR. I could have overlooked one mistake until Briitany made the situation unrepairable.

name: Taylor Campbell
text: Very quick visit, which was nice. Humble staff, and doctor. I came in to get peace of mind about feeling under the weather... The doctor couldn't give me a specific cause/reason as to why I wasn't feeling well. Which, with my anxious mind, I like to know a clear diagnosis. Otherwise, I felt better after leaving. I will definitely return based on efficiency and cleanliness of the office.

name: Sandhya Krishna
text: The wait is short and the receptionist and nurses are professional but this clinic is lacking in its primary function. The doctor didn’t introduce herself, didn’t ask me what was going on, dismissed my chief complaint and sent me home with a prescription of over-the-counter throat lozenges. She also used the term ‘crap' to describe what turns out to be a growing abscess of my tonsils. I left without any diagnosis or treatment. I also felt belittled for requesting an additional test, which was denied. I went to another urgent care later on in the day and paid another copay because of how uncomfortable I felt without any diagnosis, based off the my pain and how it was only increasing in intensity. I’m so happy this health care provider was able to immediately diagnose me. She was able to provide me with both quality patient care and treatment, that had I not gotten, would have landed me in the ER.

name: Ashley Watts
text: Super quick in getting me back and seen, probably the quickest appt I've ever had!! All the staff was very friendly 😊

name: Kyle Luce
text: The entire process at St. Vincent's Urgent Care was seamless and easy from the moment I walked in never waited more than 5-7 minutes  in between interactions with individuals and was seen by a nurse and doctor less than 15 minutes after arrival. Before leaving the office I was already beginning to feel better. For minor medical issues after Doctor office hours I will now go only to St. Vincent's Urgent Care In Homewood.

name: Shea Parks
text: I live down the street but never had the experience of visiting. All staff were very personable and friendly, while also professional and efficient. I was in and out in less than an hour. Not the nightmare I was expecting (like emergency rooms).

name: Chato Denaris
text: I was dehumanized for my language handicapped I should return with my 45 amiguos if I get sick I'm not leaving by my self.

name: Dan Thigpen
text:
Very fast and accurate care for what I was experiencing. Wonderful setting for people that work a lot and cannot always be seen by their Primary Care Physician.
Thank you for your care

name: Rita Wright
text: 10! Great experience, excellent doctor and staff. The doctor seemed thorough and took a lot of time with me. Humble, but very knowledgeable. I highly recommend

name: Tristan Harvin
text: It was good

resp.text: Thanks so much, Tristan! Our goal is to ensure that all of our patients have the best experience every time they visit our office.

name: Sean Doyle
text: I would applaud the staff that was on duty last night, from the person who answered the phone to the lady who stitched my hand back together and even the nurse who observed and the support team. Everybody was in great spirits even though they were working late to take care of me. It was a fabulous experience. You could rule the world with a staff like that. You would probably also enjoy knowing that I went to the XXXXXXXXXX ER and left because it was packed and felt uncomfortable to me ...including a police officer having to be called to settle one patient. We looked on our phones and found you were open 30 minutes later than most other urgent care facilities and immediately drove to you. Amazing.

name: C Y
text: I really appreciated that the whole staff took really good care of me knowing how I was feeling and also reassuring me everything will be ok when they had to swab my nose. They warned me and helped me through the process. Thank you for all you have done.

name: Tricia Thomas
text: Had a very painful and potentially serious injury to my shin(being diabetic) , everyone with whom I dealt was kind, concerned and swift in their duties! The doctor was excellent on several levels and I had a very overall very good experience!! Would definitely return if needed!!!

name: Jordan
text: Do not go here if you have any other options which you do in Birmingham. Very much doubted the doctors diagnosis that I got so I went and got a second opinion and that doctor thankfully knew what it was right away and how to treat it. The doctor here didn’t even address my chief complaint. Plus they are very slow which doesn’t bother me as long as you’re competent.

name: Jennifer Schuble
text: They charge my secondary insurance instead of my primary insurance.  When one calls to correct it, you get recording to pay by credit card.  Finally able to leave a message and get a call back 24 hours latter they say they correct it but they didn't.  I received a bill for $224 I could have gone anywhere in Birmingham, and it would have been cost me $0 with my blue cross cards if they filed with my primary card first!   Horrible billing services calling number that is out of state and its a recording just wanting you to pay by credit card.  When finally after being on hold for a while can leave a number for them to call you back.

name: Leslie Rivers
text: I like how convenient and close this place was . However,  it was a waste of my time, i didn't get treated for anyof my symptoms I was better off going to the e.r,and the staff was unprofessional.

name: Michael McGrath
text: Been here a couple of times and service is always extremely friendly and efficient. My goto place if primary care isnt open!

name: Royale Group
text: These people do not care about your health I went to another visit because I was still having the same symptoms shortness of breath front desk person Latonya Payne and Taylor Wells advised me I had a balance for a copayment which they did not notice at my last appointment I advised her that I only had my checkbook available they informed me that the telecheck system was down and I could not see a doctor without payment for 25.00. Because your system was down they refused to allow me to get medical attention. Dr. zills came up front and told me to take it up with the billing dept. I WILL NEVER AGAIN SUPPORT ANYTHING THAT HAS TO DI WITH THIS HOSPITAL ENDED UP GOING TO EMERGENCY DEPT AND THEY ADMITTED ME.

name: Justin Hancock
text: The only urgency this location shows, is an urgency to go home. They will turn you away for any reason, especially if it's close to closing time. Do not waste your time, they dont care.

name: Savannah —
text: I am in and out within 20 minutes at this place. They are extremely caring, knowledgeable, and efficient! Can’t believe I ever spent hours at another urgent care anywhere.

name: Krista Birmingham
text: This is the best urgent care in the area. I drive here from Cullman when I need care, because they are the best. I signed in upfront at 1113. I've already seen the doctor, and it's just now 1130. They're super helpful, and describe everything as they go so you're not in the dark.

name: Cheryl Smith
text: This is by far the finest experience I have ever had at an Urgent Care facility!  Dr. Zills was great. The staff was warm and friendly!  I just can’t say enough good things about my visit. Thank you for helping me feel better and for the excellent patient care!

name: Deborah Fine
text: 10! Thanks helping me feel better!! Everyone was friendly, professional and I was seen in a timely manner.

name: R M
text: I gave this place one star because zero is not an option.  Went in with an upper respiratory tract infection, the third time in the past four months I have had this.  In the intake paperwork I indicated that I have no primary care physician.  When the "doctor" entered, before he was even in the door he started going on, and very loudly, about how can I not have a PCP at my age and went on and on about all of the tests and procedures I needed to have done, without actually knowing anything about my history.  None of which was why I was there. This is how he spent most of his time with me.  Had he actually concentrated on why I was there, I might not still be sick four days later. Incredibly angry with this experience.

name: Brandi Sykes
text: They we're very caring, helpful and myse ne feel comfortable

name: Jason Vickers
text: Came in with symptoms of being fatigued, sinus drainage, losing my voice and dizziness. No tests whatsoever. Prescribed me over the counter meds and said come back if you don’t feel better. Very rushed while being the only patient. Two days later I felt worse so I went to Summit Express Urgent Care in Vestavia. Immediate tests and diagnosed with Strep. I was in and out with shots and prescriptions within 30 minutes. Missed another two days of work.

name: Julia Sanford
text: I visited this clinic on 12/28/17 and on 8/7/18 I am still trying to get a billing error corrected. I've spent several hours on the phone with their billing office over the past few months and was sent to collections for an amount I don't owe. I have no complaints about the care I received there, but I will not be back based on my interactions with the company that handles their billing.

name: Dana Taylor
text: I was checked in, had xrays, seen by CRNP, bandaging and on my way in less than 40 minutes! Everyone was very nice, and understanding! Will definitely recommend them to others!

name: Melissa Estes
text: I'm a single mom with two kids and I searched for a place like this for years! Proud patients for the past 3 years, they do an amazing job, convenient hours, great doctors!

name: Nancy S
text:
I needed care for my 90 year old mom on Easter.  I called to make sure they were open and talked with Emily.  I explained mom's symptoms and she put me on hold to check with the doctor.  She came back and said Dr. Miller wanted to speak with me.  Dr. Miller gave me great advice including telling me she would not recommend I bring mom to the Urgent Care facility based on my description of the symptoms.  She listened, gave direction and saved us a trip that would have been stressful for mom.

Emily and Dr. Miller came across as competent, caring and focused on taking care of patients.  Very impressive!

name: Ruth F
text: Waited about 2 hours to be seen. After having a test done, doc refused to come in and explain results or anything. He sent in a girl with my prescription who did not know anything about my test results or what actions I needed to take. I was prescribed antibiotics but she didn't know what for, or what my results were. I asked and she said she will ask the doc to come talk to me. He did not come- instead she came back and gave me an unclear dismissive answer and led me out. As I walk out of my room, the doc is just there sitting in the nursing station. He yells out "make sure you fill those and get started immediately!". After a 2 hour wait, the least he could have done was take a minute to explain what the test results were and what I need to do. He wasn't even busy just sitting around.

name: Jeremiah Blackmon
text: Christy Greenhalgh, NP was not interested in any of my concerns or complaints.  It’s best to refuse her service and demand another physician.  I will not be going back.

name: gammy v
text: Very friendly staff and short wait time. Doctor was thorough and was patient to answer many questions I had. Will use facility again.

name: Nolan Burton
text: I've been to several quick care providers in Birmingham. They are second to none.

name: Cami Tinsley
text: My regular MD is out of town so I went to get some relief for an awful sore throat and chest congestion.  The Dr. refused to give me any shots and said she did not believe in those.  That all physicians practice differently.  I just finished a z pak for these same symptoms 2 weeks ago and she prescribed another one that obviously isn't going to work and sent me on my way.  I pleaded for an injection to help give me some immediate relief and she refused.  I will not be going back here again.  I know when I am sick, which is not very often and how my body reacts to things...she would not even listen. Don't waste your time here.

name: qetuoadgjl qetuoadgjl
text: Horrible experience. I've had asthma my whole life and recently ran out of my flovent steroid inhaler over the weekend while having severe asthma symptoms and a respiratory infection. I went to St. Vincent's walk-in urgent care in Homewood. I told the "doctor," a young lady with blonde hair, that I had a respiratory infection and asthma and that I needed a steroid inhaler. She was snarky and rude and said, "Stop trying to educate me. I know about asthma." I was stunned and apologized and she said, "I don't need your medical history, this is just an urgent care clinic." It was so rude. I'm a sweet friendly people person and I was stressed with asthma and illness. They said that they were prescribing a steroid inhaler and told me to get out so that they could go home. I had to wait outside in the heat for my son to come back and get me and my asthma got worse, so he had to take me to the Brookwood ER. And, they didn't call in the steroid inhaler.

name: karyn stalcup
text: Made an appointment online. I got right in and out. Excellent staff and doctor was outstanding.

name: Danielle Hickman
text: The doctor did not seem to take me seriously when I came in for painful breathing and loss of hearing, between other symptoms. She seemed to laugh when I told her my symptoms and did not really listen to what I was saying.

name: Millie Maq
text: **only leaving 5 stars to gurantee that people see this: I came here with hopes of gettin relief for the flu. First of all, they ran out of flu test, during flu season. I understand that there is a lot of cases lately but, come on. Restock! It’s flu season after all. After I am called back and placed in a room, the woman, nurse, CNA, or whatever she is, was extremely rude and had complete disregard for anything I had to say to her. I came here to get better, not to be completely disrespected. I will not be coming back here. I hope you and your family does the same. There is many other options with much nicer patient care, I’m sure.

name: Amber Maxwell
text: Just thanks for everything.. Everyone was so nice even when I was scared to get my shot..lol

name: Tiffany Carrick
text: Rude nurse mixed diagnosis long wait time

name: Brittany Davis
text: Do not recommend..

name: Brittney Mobley
text: Horrible location honestly. The definition of Doc in a box. This place will take your money and throw a wild guess at your situation. Literally came up w bs both times. It just didn’t sit well with me.  If you are in need of real care please choose another location. I was unknowingly suffering from a real life or death emergency. Had either doctor taken the time to actual see me they would’ve know to advise additional care ESPECIALLY after my second visit. What a joke! They prescribed me Mucinex lol . Do yourself a favorite and go to a real doctor. The only consistent part is the ladies up from who are processing your PAYMENTS and the triage. I was billed $400 for 10 minutes and something I could’ve googled. T E R R I B L E!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. We sincerely apologize about the issues you experienced, and we hope to make this right. Please reach out to patientadvocate@americanfamilycare.com so we can rectify this issue. Please include your full name, DOB, and a brief detail of your experience.

name: Tymecca Lee
text: This is the worst urgent care ever. I saw nurse at 3:26. She told me to wait 15 mins and its now 4:25 and i am just leaving, after i had to leave room and go upfront and remind them i was still waiting. Completely useless...i need corporate or district number so i can let them know the conversations i also heard from the employess while i sat and waited.

name: Ryan Church
text: I had to get a COVID test back in September for a job site I was working on. My insurance company covers the test and the AFC website states that all insured patients pay no out of pocket cost for rapid test. January 4th $175 came out of my account for the test I received. I was then billed an additional $360 for the same test. I have made countless effort to get this resolved as well as my wife. This location refers us to corporate each time where we are then sent to voicemail with no call back. Our insurance company has even tried to contact to get the same outcome as us. We have even emailed and still no response! I am not paying a total of $535 for what is suppose to be a FREE test!!

resp.text: We would like the chance to turn your experience around. If you are willing to give us another chance, please reach out to us at  American Family Care - McCalla(205) 461-0038 to speak to our manager directly

name: k Harris
text: Incompetent sign in clerk. I called to ask if they do covid lab test. The receptionist says yes. I then ask if the have a long wait. She says no. I immediately drive 2 minutes up the street and the parking lot and lobby are packed. Once I get to the front to sign in, I'm told they are not doing anymore tests today. She then states they have time slots that fill up within the first hour of operation.  She should have stated this when I called. This is also a contradiction of their website which states no appointments required. A  required time slot is an appointment!!

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional.Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Dee
text:
Called AFC at 8 anout getting covid test and was told we needed to get here early that there was already a line. We arrived at 8:30. Had to sign up for the 9:20 time slot. Came back in at 9:20 and had to fill out paperwork which took 30 minutes. Then we waited in waiting area, as more and more people came in, for another 35 minutes before they called us back.

However, once we got back, we were tested quickly and the nurse practitioner was very thorough.

But it took 1 hour to find out I tested negative but that they dropped my husbands test. So he had to be retested. They will call us with those results.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional.Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Tommy Wood
text: Nightmare..  came in 1st thing this morning  to sign in and was giving a time to be back for covid test.. 220pm. Its 420pm and still not called.. was told to go to car and wait for phone call, I did that for an hour and decided to come back in. Now I see when lady calls patient names, she just keeps calling until someone walks up from inside, no one is being called thats in their car..  I do not recommend...

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional.Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Alex Weldon
text:
There is no way that it should ever humanly necessary to spend SIX AND A HALF HOURS at ANY urgent care or doctors office for a Covid rapid test and blood work. It took FIVE, yes, FIVE attempts in 4 different spots among 3 staff to finally get blood. I was forgotten about for the first 2 hours of this visit and I know I was forgotten about. I was told to wait in my car and I would receive a phone call. I eventually called back and, the lady who answered, her reaction clearly said yes, we forgot about you.

Very unprofessional, very poorly trained, borderline mal-practice.

I left in pain, in tears and very unhappy with the staff at this location. Not how anyone should leave the doctor when sick.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Patrick Randolph
text: $175+ w/no insurance to see a doc....just to say hi. Absolute rip off...easily $55 overcharge. All I needed was inhailer for asthma. All the “extra” business from COVID-19 and they still want to jack up their price because they are greedy. My wife went to urgent care in Hoover and was charged $100...I’ll drive 15mins to save $75+.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Betty Gadson
text: Went there &it was packed &super hot&extremely slow.The young lady at the 2nd desk was rude&very uncaring she kept asking me what was wrong with me I tried to tell her I cld not breathe she yelled at me&said what????????Not to mention I cld barely talk the fact that she was so insensitive &rude&laughed with the other young lady there was  ery tasteless.I left&will never ever go back there.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Mark Varner
text: When I walked into this place I told them I wanted a Covid-19 test and that I did not have insurance so I needed to know what it cost up front, which I paid in full. I was the only person in the place and it took a long time to be seen at all. I never saw a doctor. Then, today, about 2 weeks later I got a bill from them for an additional $68. I told them to let me know how much it was up front. I should not be getting a bill now. They took so long to see me I had to get up and leave and was late getting to work, then they bill me. I would not recommend them to anybody.

name: Rere Miller
text: I come here pretty often because it’s the closest clinic to my house, I went about 10 days ago to get test taken and I was told they’d be back the next day and I’d get a call, I never got a call and had to call myself and I’ve called back everyday since then and was just told they haven’t even been sent yet. It’s almost been 2 weeks I am beyond frustrated!!!

resp.text: •	We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional.Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Brittney Lake
text: I don’t think it’s right that American family care charges $150 for people with full Medicaid for a covid test. I know they got some type of money from the government to provide FREE corona virus testing! Why do they not accept Medicaid as insurance during the pandemic?

name: Zachary Guilbault
text: Absolutely terrible customer service and no info put people at risk for Covid contact. Front desk was absolutely no help.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Shelby Acre
text: Used to be super fast but over the years they have gotten so much slower. On average my visits here take somewhere around 2 hours before I even see a physician.

name: Joan Evans
text: I thought this would be a good idea coming here, never had any issues. Well, I am here for a diverticulitis flare and I have been in the examination room for over an hour!! This is ridiculous, it's not even flu season!! It's a shame when your sick and can't see your doctor, you have to sit and wait while you feel bad for over and hour and still not seen!! I will rethink this!!

name: Jennifer O'Dell
text: Very poor customer service at the front desk/reception. Amy, the NP, and her nurse were great, but they are not enough to make me feel comfortable in going back. Reception left a bad view of their overall practice in my eyes.

name: Dayshuntia Jones
text: Went this afc after seeing it was close to my home. I recommend Dr. Amy Robinson. She was kind, knowledgeable, and attentive. She showed great skill and was nurturing to my problems.

name: Lynette Askew
text: I really this this place gets a bad rap. I go in with family members and the staff is always friendly.  The doctor is super nice very kind spoken. Was in during the weekend the NP was a little smart mouth but over all great place for care. Great Job.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

name: Jannette Glass
text: Thank you AFC. I really appreciate you having this clinic in Bessemer. I think the staff is the greatest and they are knowledgeable. I used to go to cripple creek but family told me to go here. I did and I love it!!  Everyone is so willing to help and are super sweet.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive review! If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

name: Regina Essman
text: Visit on a regular basis. The only issue I have is with the black female with braids. She is rude. I do not want this to reflect on the clinic. The entire staff have always been very caring to me and my family. I speak to the manager  on a regular basis when I’m in the clinic. She is always willing to help in any way.  Teresa and the lab girl have been very professional.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive review! Our teams strive to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you found this to be the case during your visit. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out. We can't wait to see you again, have a great day!

name: Ganimation
text: I arrived at 11:51 a.m. to have a covid-19 test done for my 1-year-old son. By the time I left I had been there for 3 hours no test has been done 2 hours of that was waiting in the waiting room with him. They had the information wrong and they tried to blame me even though I did what I was supposed to do. I could hear them cutting up and cracking jokes outside of our room. Never coming back.

name: Jenifer Wade
text: This clinic and staff is always great. Bobbie always helps her staff and Dr akhtar is great could speed up but live him. My family loves the entire staff and Teresa is a ray of sunshine.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We hope you have a great day!

name: James Owens
text: Extremely slow . Also they force you to put a credit or debit card on file then when you Agree and hand it to them they slide it as a if where a transaction then make you sign digital signature. This is even with insurance and the visit was 100 % covered on insurance. Extremely shady and unprofessional avoid this place at all coast !

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again

name: shayna gulley
text: This is the WOST clinic I have ever been to! I had to wait 2 hours to get put in a room then another 35 minutes for anyone to come into the room. The chairs were uncomfortable, and after all that they didn’t call in my prescription or add in my chart what they diagnosed me with so I ended up having to go to another doctor to get my prescription for my ear infection.

name: John Stevens
text: Bessemer has some of the most caring staff and the manager is very hands on. I had an issue with my insurance she took the time to help me understand the issues with having the dreaded BEG insurance. A wonderful place to visit.

name: Mia black
text: This is the best place to get care from. Even in flu season and the long waits they are very caring and kind.  Every one should give them a chance.  Not sure about that card thing but excellent for care. My granny loves them.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

name: Jennifer Smith
text: Bessemer has the best staff very professional!  Dr Akhtar is wonderful and the staff is very professional and are great at helping. My family loves to go here!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

name: Jonathan Thomas
text: Great service. Entire staff was very knowledgeable and kind. Pleased with my experience here.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

name: Amanda Reed
text: This place was clean, staff was very friendly, and not a long wait time. I was in and out in an hour! Will definitely go back and would definitely recommend to others

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

name: Emily Gunn
text: Wonderful staff great NP Conrad Cash. Took care of my family member. Brittany was super sweet

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We hope you have a great day!

name: Anita Lawson
text: The facility was clean, the staff was friendly and professional and my wait time was very minimal. Also, I had to have a steroid shot and Teresa did an awesome job, I never even felt it. It was a good experience and very much appreciated.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive review! Our teams strive to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you found this to be the case during your visit. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out. We can't wait to see you again, have a great day!

name: Christen McCay
text: Amazing staff!! Everyone is always super nice and the lady that gave me my shots today was wonderful!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive review! If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

name: Dandricka Atchison
text: I have always used AFC in Bessemer for my mother and as always her visit was great. The manager is always caring and when I had an issue she called and followed up with me and resolved my concerns. I just love DrTaylor he is the best. Continue doing great work. Shout out to Tiffany and Teresa. The light skin lady in the lab could use a little sprucing up on her interaction with people but I know you can change personalities. Overall Great service as usual my mother loves you !!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive review! Our teams strive to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you found this to be the case during your visit. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out. We can't wait to see you again, have a great day!

name: Julie Slater
text: Very sick with the flu and the staff was kind and understanding. Hopefully on the road to feeling better now, thank you!

name: Katya Freebie
text: This used to be a good place to go.  I came here with a sinus infection and the female doctor gave me amoxicillin which did nothing.  Not getting better, I returned to the clinic where the other doctor questioned why I was given amoxicillin and said it normally was not given for that and would not help.  Both times it was a long wait.  3 weeks later I am back and was left waiting while everyone else was called.  After 35 minutes I managed to get someone's attention who then got the lady that works at the desk.  She said she thought I was waiting on someone despite having watched me sign in.  I thought ok they will call me back soon.  Nope.  They literally called everyone else first.  Now I did nothing rude or untoward to cause anyone to have a grudge against me so I have no explanation for that behavior. 30 minutes later I am sitting in the exam room waiting for a staff person before the doctor will see me.  No explanation of why.  Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere.  I would have left but I'm too sick and have too much time invested for this trip.

resp.text: It's upsetting to hear that your experience was anything but stellar. We would like to work towards a resolution, so if you are willing, please reach out to us at (205) 461-0038 to discuss this further.

name: Jeremy Breland
text: My daughter is a student in Bham and went here last weekend after waking up feeling terrible. We were very unhappy with the service. She saw a nurse practitioner who was incredibly rude when our daughter wanted to have us on speakerphone while talking with her. After 2-3 questions the NP just walked out and said I’m not doing this anymore. I’ll only talk to you. Pretty sure the patient has the right to have her parents on the phone while talking through antibiotic and steroid shot options but that just didn’t suit her so she walked out. I told my daughter to leave that minute. When she got up to leave the nurse practitioner came out to ask if she was going to leave a bad review for her online. What?!? That’s your biggest concern, a bad review? Wow. Just wow. Long story short I had her go  across town to children’s urgent care on Hwy 280 and had a fantastic experience there. Professional, kind (to her AND us) and didn’t leave her sitting in a room for well over an hour. We will never visit AFC again. Terrible service and terrible experience.

resp.text: It's upsetting to hear that your experience was anything but stellar. We would like to work towards a resolution, so if you are willing, please reach out to us at 205-461-0038 to discuss this further.

Got tired of so many questions  with answers one had to choose from longer than I am tall.  And really, gender or transgender? If nurses or doctors cannot tell that, I certainly do not think they should be treating anyone. I left  with no treatment because for it to be an urgent care facility, I could have died while answering the questions for my urgent care!

name: Linda Cameron
text: I have COPD and no doctor could prescribe anything except inhalers so Dr Achtar told my daughter to have me come see him. I was constantly coughing. name: Tyra Hoggle
text:
We were staying in the area for the Thanksgiving holiday. My granddaughter had fever, sore throat and body aches.  I had severe headache and body aches as well. I had looked up and noticed AFC was open at 8am and was very thankful. (We arrived around 8:30) Only 2 cars in the parking lot at the time.  As we were signing in,  one person came out that had been seen by the NP that was on call.  I was finally taken back to be triaged and put in a room.  My daughter and granddaughter were still in waiting room for another 10 mins or so before they were taken back to be triaged and put into a room.

Once in a room, I waited for a little while and the NP came in and saw me.  She was great! She told me someone would be in to swab me for the flu and strep. Head hurting, lying on the bed...all I heard was talking and laughing coming from the nurses station.  Waited for what seemed like forever...still no one shows up to check on me.  I go to the restroom across the hall from my room and came back out to the nurses sitting at the station talking about Thanksgiving, shopping, etc. I then asked if my orders to be swabbed had been sent to them.  They all opened their laptops and said oh yes, here it is. "Someone will be with you in a moment".  Then a moment of silence from them and then the chattering back and forth began again.

A couple of minutes later the nurse that came in was Kia, very sweet and kind.  I had not met or even saw her until she came into do the swab. She did apologize for the delay and said that she had previously been in with another patient. I laid my head back down and then texted by daughter a few minutes later and asked her if my granddaughter had been swabbed as well.  She said she had not been.  I then went back outside my door and asked if anyone had been in to swab by granddaughter and was told yes...without even giving them her name at first. My daughter heard them bold face lie to me.  I told them that I knew that no one had been in there to swab her and expected it to be done ASAP because she was very sick. A "professional" to lie to my face is repulsive.

Again Kia, was the nurse sent into the room to do the swab.  After the test came back on me, a totally different nurse came into the room and gave me my shots.  I never saw one of the ones sitting at the desk again.  That is where they stayed.  My granddaughter finally received her diagnosis as strep and was also given a shot.  The shot was given by Kia.

Where were all the other nurses that had nothing to do but sit around the desk and chit chat all morning?  For us being the only patients there during all of this time, it should not have taken 2 hours. I don't mind waiting at all if there is a good reason but this particular day and location, there was no reason for this to be a 2 hour visit.  This is what will happen you have a full staff on hand but only a couple of them are actually working.

resp.text: Our manager would really like to speak with you more regarding this matter. Please reach out to us at (205) 461-0038. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Lydia
text: Dr. Powell and the entire staff at AFC are professional, compassionate, and knowledgeable about all manners of health care. I felt relaxed and assured that I was getting the best care for my illness. I am truly grateful for Dr. Powell and staff at AFC. Thank you

resp.text: Lydia Lewis, thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to the team here at American Family Care - Bessemer! If you have any further questions, please don't hesitate to reach out!

name: Mrs. Clark Williams
text: Extremely slow. Had to wait an hour in the front and another hour in the back. No one came to advise me on wait time. All I needed was two shots. After waiting an hour in a room, I finally walked out to see a nurse. No one was at the station in the back. I saw someone else and asked them and she rudely stated that she was the only doctor and had no idea. After waiting another 15 minutes, I finally left and asked for a refund.  It wasn't until then that they finally said they could help me. I was definitely offended at this point. It shouldn't take me asking for a refund to get help. I will never go to this place again because they obviously don't value people's time and patience. I would rate a negative, if that option was available.

name: Melinda Jacobs
text: My husband and I went there because they advertise that they do Family Practice. I have a condition that does not allow me to drive and he works 6 days a week with very long hours. Weekends are the only time we have to go. We were open with them about this. Our old primary care physician is too far away now that we have moved. We were treated like drug addicts because we both take some strong medicine which we never asked them to fill. Them called in medicine that was wrong. The amount of insulin they called in for me to take would have killed me. Thank goodness the pharmacist caught it, however it took 3 days to get the doctor to fix it. So I went 3 days without insilin. Then he didn't call in the needles for the insulin pens. I called for those and they called in syringes instead of pen needles like I asked for. So again another night without insulin. When they finally got it right I was told to find a primary care doctor to handle all the issues I have. They are supposed to be my primary care doctor now. The issues I have are that they can't get anything right with my prescriptions. I'm not the problem here. It scares me how bad they don't listen and transfer information and then want to blame the patient.

resp.text: Melinda, we regret to hear that you had a negative experience with us, but would appreciate the chance to turn your experience around. We appreciate you bringing this experience to our attention. If you are willing, please contact us at (205) 461-0038 so we can work towards a resolution. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Ariel Wagner
text: I have never been so displeased with a business in my entire life period. I arrived at 2. It is now 5:30 and I have yet to see the Doctor. My girlfriend has taken a 3 hour nap in the exam room without disturbance. I am here for an X-ray for my hand. That's it. It takes less than 10 seconds to say the phrase "it's broke"/"it's not broke". I have gone to the extent to open my exam room door to ensure the doctor understands there are living people still in this room that have been waiting for 3 hours and it just so happens the business closes in 30 minutes. I will never step foot in this business again.

resp.text: Greetings. We appreciate your feedback. We welcome the opportunity to address all concerns. I am the patient advocate, and I can be reached at (205) 403-8902.. Thank you for allowing us to learn from you. Stay well.

name: Jeremy Bahnsen
text:
Never seen such a bait and switch set up. They make you think you're getting in quick and then you spend well over an hour in the exam room before seeing the doctor (we still haven't seen him yet). I guess that way the waiting room looks empty and people will stay. And it doesn't matters that it is a holiday. I've never waited so long in the exam room waiting to see the doctor.
UPDATE: we've now seen the doctor and he is very thorough. My wife was very pleasedifficult with him. Just need to do a better job warning patients how long it might be when the place looks empty.

resp.text: Thank you very much for your feedback as well as your update. I am very grateful I was able to speak to you before leaving the clinic. I will use your feedback to make sure we do a better job in communication with our patients.  Again I truly apologize about your wait time. I hope that your wife feels better and may you be blessed with a wonderful new year.

name: casie franklin
text:
This place is a joke. Do not waist your time and money, but  seriously they lack in knowledge and experience!
.
They misdiagnosed my shingles with contact dermatitis..... and said my other symptoms of the shingles was due to a sinus infection.... sent me home with steroid shot, an itching med., steroid pack, and antibiotic.

They drew blood and said that my WBC was on the rise ( like they had been charting it over time), instead of saying my white blood count was elevated. Anyway she said that was from my sinus infection.
The shingles will also make your WBC go up.

On another occasion, my husband fell late in the evening and not sure why he stopped into AFC, but they sent him  home and told him that there was nothing wrong with it.  Long story short he still has problems with that shoulder. He ended up tearing a muscle.

Needless to say, I will never go back to AFC Bessemer/McCalla location.
Trust me go to the next red light and  take a left and go to Middle Creek Medical Center. I’ve never had a bad experience, or peronally heard of a bad review from them. My whole family has went to them and the ONLY reason I stopped into AFC this time was because I drove to Middle Creek and they had closed early this day. And I was feeling so bad. I should have went home because I knew better! That’s why I went and got a second opionion because I knew it wasn’t contact dermatitis!!!!!!! ( from personal experience plus I work in health care).

I never got seen by a MD. Only a Nurse Practioner.

resp.text: We appreciate all reviews, and appreciate you giving us the chance to improve by providing us with this feedback. Thank you again for taking the time to let us know how we can improve. We hope you will consider us again in the future. Take care.

name: Jeff Lewis
text: Staff was great. Best experience I've had at a doctor's office in a long time, even better than my regular primary care doctor.

name: Simone English
text: I visited with Dr. Harden on July 12, 2018 at American Family Care Bessemer, AL at approximately 5:30pm. Over the course of my visit with this MD in regards to my foot pain, he was very rude and harassed me about my weight. Upon entering the exam room, MD  requested that my daughter (2yrs old) turn off my personal cell phone without acknowledging me as the patient. Then he proceeds to insinuate that my foot pain is due to my weight. Also, he used  an analogy stating that my body weight was more like an “elephant and not a bull”;  therefore, I need to eat more vegetables and not high protein diets. Additionally, he not only harassed me about my weight but provided his personal opinion that I was "ruining my child” by allowing her to watch tv on my cellular device. Furthermore, he communicated that my child "must be a daycare baby” because she seeking attention from me while I was being examined. Lastly, he communicated that I should let him keep my daughter because he could "turn a 'F' child into a 'A' child." This MD’s words throughout my visit was harassment, derogatory and unacceptable.

name: Roz Dear Momma
text: The foreign doctor listened to me and researched other doctors notes before settling on my plan of care. She returned to tell me I was right! Urgent Care Doctors seldom care what the previous doctor treatment was. They follow their own treatment regimen.  She abliged me and did a more extensive lab. She confirmed sinusitis by elevated white blood cells. Although my urine appeared clean it was sent out for a culture. Funny, once I started antibiotics my 5-6 night trips to restroom decreased to 3 then 2. What a blessing to get some sleep again! I'm bad and do sip water through the night when I wake up thirsty. No more E.R. visits for non-emergencies. When ill who needs long waits and bandaid therapy, brushed off and told to make appt with your primary doctor. Urgent Care has faster triage, service in general and more likely to address EACH problem not just your MAJOR problem;-)

resp.text: Hi Roz, thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us at American Family Care - Bessemer. We're happy we could meet your expectations! We sincerely thank you for the positive review, and look forward to seeing you again soon!
