name: lyndsey clevenger
text: I have been forgotten twice in a cold dim lit waiting room. I went in feeling like I had the flu and no tests were done. Was told it was a cold and given a steroid shot and sent home. Went back next day feeling even worse and demanded to be tested for the flu. Guess what. That's what I had. They don't test properly but still charge you a fortune. They love to give you a steroid shot and send you home for everything.

name: Nikita Monroe
text: Staff was very rude when I asked to speak to the manager concerning personal information. Manager did not act very  professional  Nor did she look professional.

name: Adam Zeidan
text:
For your and your family's safety, avoid this place at all costs.

Inhuman and immoral.

After signing my mother in, she began choking on her own mucus. I tried to perform CPR on her, but was unsuccessful. I then rushed her to the front where I exclaimed the situation to the woman at the front desk. She went to get the doctor, but not before finishing her text. She took too long, so I rushed my mother to the back myself.

At this point, I was surprised that she was even conscious, but we made it to the doctor whom I begged for help... and was completely and utterly unwilling to help due to the fact that they had not finished processing our paperwork.

I was convinced that my mother was going to die, so I gave her mouth-to-mouth​ in hopes that it will give her enough air to dispurse the mucus. She was able to cough up enough to allow small short breaths of air, and I begged again for them to help her. They still refused, and suggested that I take her to the hospital. There was a chance that my mother would not make it to the ER, and would suffocate before reaching the ER, but the doctors here would rather let a woman die in front of them instead of bend the rules of their job once.

I was able to get my mother to Shelby Hospital before she suffocated, and she was given an inhaled medicine that the hospital physician told me that an Urgent Care Center like American Family Care should have already had.

Bottom line is that if you care about your safety and the safety of your loved ones, go someplace else. Even if that place is 100 miles away. The people here would rather see you or your loved one die instead of going out of their way to help. Yes it's immoral; Yes it's inhuman, but that's who they are.

resp.text: Adam Zeidan, we pride ourselves on providing exceptional service, so we are disappointed to hear that your visit with us was anything less than satisfactory. We would like the opportunity to find out how we can better assist you in the future. If you are willing, please contact us (205) 605-0495.

name: Rachel McGuff
text:
As someone who works until 6:30 and isn't usually able to take time off work to go to the doctor, I rely on this location because its close to home and is open until 8. However, I have been seriously disappointed the last few times I've been to this facility. First and foremost, the Friday before Easter, I was ill and needed to come in for antibiotics. My fiance and I arrived at 7:15 only to find them closed. AFC used to be quick- in and out in an hour. As I write this I've been sitting here for an hour in the lobby. Haven't even been called back to triage or a room yet. Not to mention, when I checked in and paid my copay the receptionist tried to discourage me from being seen. "If you get tired of waiting, we will refund your money." I asked if there was a long wait, she stated that the doctor was only seeing seven patients at a time and that there were seven in the back already and "five thousand" in the lobby. After this, I watched the same receptionist pseudo turn away three more people, discouraging them to check in because of the "long wait". All three left, one a teenage girl with her mother, limping and in tears. If people come here, they obviously have a reason. This is a facility that is designated to help ill and injured people, and if that impedes your off time, then so be it. Most people in the working world have to stay late from time to time. Good workers still do their job. Also, the doctor may only be seeing 7 patients at a time, but there are more than 7 rooms in the facility. Instead of having people that are already unwell sit in the uncomfortable lobby chairs for hours at a time, they could move people to the vacant rooms so they could be more comfortable. Even still, this location always seems to be this busy so why on earth is there only one doctor on staff? Makes no sense. The last few times I have been in this facility for either me or my fiance, we have had to wait for at least two hours. There was one occasion that we didn't get out until almost 10pm, at which point I would have had to drive 25 minutes to get to a pharmacy that would be open and able to fill my scripts. I've been to Shelby ER and have been taken to a room faster than this. More to follow....

Update: 1.5 hours. Still in the waiting room. Still with two patients in front of me.

Back in a room. Angelise triaged me. She's a doll. Best part of this experience so far. She has great communication skills and was still upbeat even with it being 8:45 by the time I was triaged.

Took me another hour to see the doctor, Dr. Habert. I could tell what the holdup was when he spent a lot of time chatting with us in the room. I didn't mind that so much. Its better than seing a doctor for less than a minute when you wait for hours. What I did mind was being told that my diagnosis, walking pneumonia, was a result of dairy products. Now, to be clear, I didn't have an issue with this and I heard him out at the time, but by the time I got home, I researched it, and couldn't find any correlation or any research to support his statements... He was very nice and had a great bedside manner. But maybe we shouldn't be misinforming patients? Just a thought.

resp.text: Hi Rachel, thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent experience. We are disappointed to hear that you are not satisfied with your visit. Thanks for bringing this matter to our attention. We would like to get more details about this; please reach out to us at your earliest convenience at (205) 605-0495.

name: Courtney Barnes
text: I have been sick for a month, in this time I have gone to AFC twice have had numerous shots and medicines and still not better. After me second set of meds I called back and spoke with a nurse and advised of my situation and I needed to speak to someone because sick for a month over 200 in copays and not better, I'm not paying them anymore money. The nurse advised me she would have the doctor call me, I have yet to get a call back or any help.. This is a horrible way to treat patients. I won't be back and I will deter anyone I know from going there.

name: Haley Holden
text: Went in with body aches and a developing cough after being around my boyfriend who had mycoplasma. Doctor told me he wouldn't do blood work because it's "not a very accurate test" and only swabbed my nose for the flu. He gave me 5 days of antibiotics and some codeine. Well, I'm done with the antibiotics and I've been in bed for 3 days because my symptoms have gotten worse. Weakness, painful sinuses, cough is worse. I am relying on vitamins and NyQuil until I find a real doctor that will take the time to treat me.

name: Elsa Cream
text:
My first experience with this establishment was absolutely horrifying. My grandmother had fell causing her lip to bust open and was in need of stitches, so this medical facility was the closest and hopefully cheapest choice, But on arrival i was treated with such disrespect. I checked her in and give the nurses my grandmothers information and helped her back, but i wasn't allowed any further, so I go to wait in the lobby and waited for an hour. I go to ask how my grandmother is doing but the nurses acted like they didnt know what i was talking about so i ask how much longer was it going to be and they ignored me so i go back to sit and waited for another hour. I go up to ask about my grandmother again only to be given the same response as before, I get frustrated so i go out to check on my car, and as i was trying to come back to the lobby the doors were locked. I was locked out in the cold and had no idea what condition my grandmother was in so I knocked on the door until a nurse noticed and she just stood there staring at me. I wave her over but she ignored me and went back behind her desk.I dont know why i was treated like this but i can only come up with that my skin color wasn't white (all the nurses were white). It was 15 degrees out so i went back and waited in my car. A few minutes go by i see a cop car come by and he parks in front of the building like he got a call, and then i see him looking around the whole building for somebody (im guessing me). But i stay in my vehicle until he leaves. After all that i see my grandmother finally come out after 4 hours of waiting. Again i illiterate: i dont know why they treated me like a second class citizen but i guess its cause im not white.

In summary: This medical facility locked me out and called the police on me for my skin color. I am humiliated for being treated like this but sadden to know that they might mistreat everybody that isnt white.

resp.text: Elsa, we regret to hear that you had this experience with us. Please reach out to us so we can work towards a resolution. Thanks again for bringing this to our attention. We hope to hear from you soon. All the best, American Family Care - Alabaster (205) 605-0495

name: Chase Matherson
text: Place sucks.

name: Stacy Tibbals
text: I visited the AFC Alabaster on 3/31/2014 just after lunch.  I had what most would call a toothache. I, however,  called it the forces of nature trying to rip out my insides through a small opening in my exposed gum.  Anyway, I am also a Medicare patient who cannot just up and make an appointment with a dentist or oral surgeon like everyone else.  I have to get any dental procedures approved through Medicare, which by the way doesn't happen the same day (usually a 72 hour turn around, even then you are not guaranteed approval).  I had an infection and had eaten an entire bottle of 20 Alleve in about 48 hours.  I entered the facility expecting just average level of concern and kindness.  What I encountered when I got there was anything but that!  The front office staff was so nice and professional!  However, the best was yet to come!  The nurse who called me back and took my vitals was just such a lovely young woman. The EPITOME of professional, kind and sympathetic that one would look for while in pain visiting ANY doctor's office, but often never receiving.   Then, Dr. Pike entered the room.  I have seen Dr. Pike before while I was sick, and he was always professional.  Maybe, I am being swayed by the amount of discomfort I was in, but this doctor acted as if he were a concerned family member!!    I was SO IMPRESSED WITH MY VISIT FROM THE SECOND I ENTERED THE BUILDING UNTIL I LEFT!  I do have a PCP who practices several cities away.  Whenever I cannot get into his office (AND NOT RECEIVE THE KIND OF CARE LIKE I DID AT AFC-ALABASTER) I will more than definitely return here and also WOULD HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!!  I PROMISE, YOU WILL BE SATISFIED.  If not, you might want to check out the Brookwood Hospital..........PSYCHE UNIT that is!!!  :-)  :-)   :-)        I also ready the review below by a Miss Cheyenne.......JUST REMEMBER some folks come in with a bad attitude or being rude or just looking for pain pills............Those types of people make it rough on everyone.......even the other patients waiting to see the doctor.........If you have once ounce of decency in your body, there is no way you would get treated in such a manner.  Her comment is disgusting and sounds like she did not get what she was after.  Doctors and staff are trained to recognize drug seeking behaviours in folks....If you are truly there for a medical problem, you will be treated with as much respect as you give to others.

name: shane smith
text: Never have had any problems with the actual visits...doctors and staff are very nice and professional..the billing dept could be a lot better..every time i ve taken my daughter its always "u dont owe a copay" even though i know i do..try to pay them for that day..they say no..if there is a charge we will mail u something..ok..thats great, right?..then receive a bill yesterday from visits in 2013..i'd rather just pay the 30 bucks each visit and not pay for 6 all at once

name: Beth Edwards (CurlUpWGoodBook)
text:
First, the front office staff and the medical assistant were AMAZING! The nurse and the medical assisant run this place!
Now, The NP was barely even in the room with me.  The medical assistant was still checking my bp and had not taken any labs yet and then another one came in with a steroid shot and antibiotic shot. So I was being given two shots as treatment YET NO LABS HAD BEEN DONE. SO what exactly what she treating me for? Strange to recieve shots before labs....and then she never even came back in the room...the medical assistant walked in and mumbled something about take your meds and went to leave. I had to stop him and ask him what medications I was given and what my test results were. He then had to go and ask the NP and try to get an answer and came back and mumbled ok follow me...next thing i knew i was being pushed out the door and i had no idea what meds i was given or where to pick them up. I stopped him and he had to go back and ask the NP AGAIN....all of this could have been prevented had she seen me and given me the results to begin with like a dr should. he comes back 20 min later and tells me that my meds got sent to calera and they got them changed to alabaster. only thing i was given was a Zpack. i was miserable for several days and could not sleep so i finally went to another urgent care and recieved the care i needed. I was also told I had a raging UTI and that zpac would not touch it....so they gave me Bactrim....so the NP ran all these tests on me and even my urine but didnt follow through.  I will not be back. After Dr G & Dr Pike left it has just been awful. I tried to continue to use AFC alabaster but after this experience...i WILL NOT. and I will be putting this review on google.

Decided to give them one more shot....went to visit last week because I was extremely sick....i mean EXTREMELY......imagine my surprise when the same NP came in ...and provided the SAME horrible service...talked down to me like I was an idiot....same responses as my last visit.....same meds....no blood drawn....left me in the room for over 2 hours for two simple tests and then nothing.....just came back in, gave me a shot, and pushed me out the door. I am done with this place. I will never be back and it looks like that is the same for alot of people because there was no one in the waiting room...never saw another patient while i was there... I wont be surprised if the place shuts down before long. You can only treat people like idiots for so long before they return the favor. Sorry not sorry. BYE!

resp.text: Beth Edwards, we're so glad that we were able to go above and beyond your expectations!

name: Stuart Smith
text:
During an office visit 5/3/2017 I passed out while my blood was being drawn and took quite a fall from the exam table straight forward onto the floor.  While the young girl did a good job trying to break my fall I now find myself with head and shoulder pain.  Very unsafe approach to drawing blood that placed the patient and care giver in danger.

I was prescribed a high dose of the steroid Prednisone and for the last 3 days have had continual hiccups keeping me awake for three straight nights.  When I called today the nurse acknowledged that was a side effect and would get something called in for me.  I later called back to find out the doctor refused. No call back to let me know and no explanation even though I'm in misery. Combine this with the head and shoulder pain I now have from taking a fall off their exam table when my blood was drawn I'd say they don't deserve positive rating of any form.   I can't believe they treated me this way.

resp.text: Hi Stuart Smith, we regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Please reach out to use directly at (205) 605-0495 when you have a chance. Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you.

text:
I normally write newspaper articles and blogs but my experience at this facility warranted a review.

I visited urgent care where I had an absolutely horrendous and definitely terrifying experience with Dr. Kidd. Not only was she extremely rude and dismissive, she offered no assistance or suggestion on my positive COVID-19 results. This “Dr.” literally yelled and spoke to me in a very condescending manner without having any general knowledge on my file, only my appearance. Not only did she walk out the room without notice but also seemingly threw my results paper at me.

I spoke with Jamila, who sincerely apologized. She also said that she would inform her manager, which I have not heard from since visiting.

Unable to connect with someone for assistance, I set up the online portal and finally found the results online. The review is a suggestion of staff training.

name: olivia hawthorne
text:
My daughter encountered very poor medical treatment  at this urgent care today.  A negative covid test alone, does not mean that patient’s are not sick. You are the health care provider and should know what diagnostic testing is needed based on symptoms,  but I guess you would not know what a patient’s chief complaints are if you are not gathering your clinical data. The female physician was not very professional at all. She did not seem very interested in finding out what was causing my daughter’s medical complaints.
I work in the health care profession also and I understand that we are all stressed to our limits but it still does not change the fact that our main focus is the patient!!
First and last visit!!

We would like the chance to turn your experience around. If you are willing to give us another chance, please reach out to us at AFC PriMed -  Eastchase (334) 323-1330

text: After a 1 hour and 45 min wait to get in the building (with an appointment), the doctor spent less than 60 seconds with us.  Dr. Kidd behaved as if we had wasted HER time because my daughter tested negative for covid.  I did not make an appointment for covid testing, but that is all they did, no solutions to the symptoms that brought us there.  The doctor literally told us to "come back if symptoms worsen" then turned her back and walked out.  The nurse who took vitals was extremely rude as well and asked my daughter, "What's wrong with you?" (in an annoyed tone) because she was tearful that someone had just stuck a stick up to her brain!  I use AFC in Montgomery all the time, but never again at this location.

name: Daniel Schrader
text:
Terrible service. I made an appointment for a covid test, and got there on time. They gave me 5 papers to fill out and said "wait in your car for a phonecall." After almost an hour, I go back in to ask what's going on, only to find out that the papers are for a doctor's visit and there's 10 people ahead of me.
Only then was I told I can skip the doctor and pay $150 to take the test. So I do, and get told to drive to the back to get swabbed. The lady at the back says it'll be 15 minutes, and I could stay where I was. Less than 10 minutes later, I get told off by someone else saying I can't park there and need to move.
So, I park in a nearby spot where I can see the door and wait. After 15 more minutes, I go back in to ask for my results, and get told there's someone at the back.

All in all, I was there nearly 2 HOURS for a test that should be 15 minutes, and I spent the whole time being told conflicting info. Never once did I get a call, and things only moved when I called or went inside to ask directly.
Never been here before, and never going here again.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

She's personable and always asks about my daughter who she's only met once, but to remember her is something that shows me that she is genuine about her connections with her patients. Brad was very nice as well! He walked me through the X-ray process and ensured that I was confident and comfortable with the information I received! My overall experience was great! Better than any location I've ever visited!

text: The staff was amazing! The care they gave was top-notch. This place has the best nurses and Practitioners ever! If you’re looking for the best care for your loved ones, you can count on them! text: I went to them because it was closer than my original doctor and they were very nice. They kept me aware of the time I would be seen and I didn’t have to wait long at all. I would recommend going here if you can’t get to your own doctor!

name: Dare Watson
text: I don't usually review places, but this has been on my mind since I got home yesterday. I went into this AFC because I have been feeling ill with sinus pressure and body aches. Everything was quick and easy at first, I got signed in, filled out my paperwork, paid my copay, and in less than 10 minutes, I was in the back getting my vitals done and such. The nurse was very nice and thorough. Then I met the doctor. I didn't catch his name, as he didn't introduce himself. Rather, he walked into the door and commented that I had gained 15 pounds since my last visit. (Keep in mind, I'm here for my cold symptoms) He asked if I was okay with this. (I'm not even remotely overweight or unhealthy) Then he comments on my acne and asks what I'm doing about it. I have hormonal acne and it will flare up when I'm sick or for other reasons. These two things had absolutely nothing to do with why I was here and it left me feeling embarrassed and ashamed. My primary care doctor is who I would talk to about those things, not an Urgent Care doctor. I would understand if it had anything to do with why I was there, but it had nothing to do with it. I will never be back to this location because I would rather not be made to feel embarrassed and humiliated, especially when I already don't feel well physically.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback about your experience with us. We would like to have a better understanding about your experience. Please reach out to us at (334) 323-1330 at your earliest convenience and we will do our best to resolve this with you.

"Needless to say,  we went to Urgent Care.......Me, my mom, and my 4 yr old daughter have the flu. This is something we attempted to catch early on. However, they were so quick to rush us out and misdiagnose us, until the flu was pretty much in rare form by the time we actually were treated for it . I never want to visit this place again.

name: Kara Lynn Moncrief
text:
My experience with Paul Jordan, just hours ago, was horrific.

From saying “wow you smell so good” .. to proceeding to ask, what the exact fragrance I was wearing was.. and constantly attempting to “rub” my right arm and right leg and back was just the the start.

Shea (unsure of her position there as she was not wearing a name badge) was disturbingly rude; lacked OVERALL common sense, especially when needing to aid the WONDERFUL receptionist at the end of my visit, to simply print my paperwork.
She also compared my diagnosis of a viral infection to “AIDS” ..  in-which I kindly suggested that she NOT use that comparison to any other patients moving forward-

I left extremely bothered, disrespected, violated, forgotten about, ALL while feeling even more sickly
with no solution to my illness.
Again, I am beyond discouraged as I trusted my health to be taken seriously.

Being asthmatic, dealing with PAUL JORDAN (whom only practices medicine IN-OFFICE ONCE A WEEK (Friday’s) & SHEA.....apparently closing up that clinic shortly after 6PM was more important than completing the submittal of e-processing my inhaler. [My pharmacist was VERY TROUBLED by this]

I strongly urge others to NOT seek medical attention of Paul Jordan.

This is not a Google rant review as I will be reporting this to the appropriate boards-

She asked me nothing about my problem, nor did she even access any body part that had to do with my complaint.

I’m a nurse practitioner, which I NEVER tell other practitioners when I’m a patient. I was absolutely appalled at not only her lack of professionalism, but also her actual medical practice. This is a great way for something very serious to be missed. Save yourself time and money and go somewhere else. The clinic was also unclean in the rooms. The lobby was nice, but the exam rooms were not.

I didn't feel brushed off or that someone was just telling me what they think. They did take the samples and made it efficient . I also liked the follow-up call. Thanks.

My most recent visit lead to an awkward interaction. The receptionist placed my cards on the counter whereas I handed them to her in her hand. I politely told her I wanted my cards in my hand and thanked her. She may have understood. That didn't  show. I'm changing my review to reflect the experience.

text:
Went to AFC Friday with my son. So glad I did he was sicker than I thought but they took great care of him. They were fast and efficient.
My son is doing better now thanks to AFC.

name: Sheraton Tikita Graham
text: I went to this doctor office today and I was their first patient @8am...and I had a very wonderful experience with  Dr. S. Miguel and nurse Candace...I was in and out and even the receptionist was even friendly with a smile I definitely recommend this doctor office and I hope you guys experience wonderful services as well....Good Luck!!!🤗

name: Tammi Odom
text: I am pregnant, and I've been having coughing fits. I was told to go somewhere like AFC by my O.B. office a couple of months ago when I had the flu. Right off the bat the doctor was rude. The doctor told me that I likely have walking pneumonia, but said she doesn't treat pregnant women. That would have been nice to know 2 hours ago before you took my insurance money. She told me I need a prescription of antibiotics, but she refused to write one for me. 🙄

name: Nikitta Forbes
text: DO NOT go here. They are misleading and will misdiagnose you. PLEASE DO NOT COME HERE. Went in for a DOT physical only to find out a health condition prevents me from getting my CDL. The doctor knew of this condition prior to the physical (I overheard her discussing my case with someone outside of my room) but did not disclose this info until AFTER she'd given the physical. During the physical, she rushed through it...she didn't even introduce herself. She hopped on this chance to take advantage as she gave the WORSE and rushed physical.  DO NOT SEE DR. DIXIE KIDD

name: Katrice Wright
text: AFC is my 1st choice for urgent care. They are quick to help, comforting, and friendly. They've taken care of me and my children with top-notch precision and even called back to make sure we're ok. Thanks friends!

name: Terry Nicholas
text: Staff was polite, professional, and prompt.  I was in and out in a timely manner

resp.text: If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

name: Whitney Jackson
text: Very friendly and helpful all of the staff went out of there way to comfort my son while he was extremely sick

name: Mason Chandler
text: This is the most incompetent medical clinic I have ever visited.  I went to them during the summer of 2015 for allergy injections.  Each time, it took an hour after I was in the examination room to receive my allergy injection, which is something a nurse performs, not a doctor.  The staff was constantly changing, so they always had to verify what amount to inject and had to call the clinic in Birmingham that makes the serum as no one could find the written record from the previous visits.  My last visit with them was in September of 2015.  A year later, I received a call from a collection agency saying I owe them money.  No letter came in the mail to me letting me know I owed them money because they put a different address into their system than where I lived.  I wrote on the check-in sheet on the very first visit where I lived.  They mailed statement letters to an incorrect address and never made a phone call in an attempt to receive payment from me.  When I called them about this, they could not explain why my address was incorrectly put into the system and said it was not their policy to make phone calls.  I would never recommend this clinic to anyone, and, in fact, would recommend finding anywhere else to go for medical care.

name: kristie sori
text: Everyone here is very professional and friendly. They know what they are doing. Dr Kidd is the best!

name: Lasheena Crenshaw
text: Best urgent care experience! Staff & physician both outstanding!

name: Jessica McMillian
text: Pushed me through so fast. Didnt listen to my complaints. Didnt even tell me personally what they thought I had. No doctors note and didnt even sign the paper they gave me..  now Ive been sick for over a WEEK and its gotten worse.

resp.text: We regret to hear that you had a negative experience with us, but would appreciate the chance to turn your experience around. If you are willing to give us another chance, please reach out to us at 334-323-1330 to speak to our manager directly.

name: David Washington
text: Beautiful! And Professional💪😉

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive review! We hope you have a great day!

name: Candace Bryant
text: 10 Great service Kendra was very gentle while giving my injections and my X-ray she made sure I was not nervous and comfortable the entire time..I will definitely be coming back if I have any other health problems

name: Paula Stinchcomb
text: The best experience I have ever had at this type of care center. From the front desk staff to the medical assistant to the Doctor, they were top notch.  Dr Williams was outstanding.

name: JSDRTR
text: Everything was going good till I was put in a room four 3 hours. I never saw a Dr. That day. Just wish someone would have keep me updated.

name: Donna Lovelette
text: Went in because of coughing,sneezing, low grade fever, slimy white mucus. Vitals taken at 1:17, went to exam room 6. Within minutes tech came in to do flu & strep swabs. He informed me the test would take about 17 minutes. After sitting a long time, dr came in asked what my symptoms were. Told him. He then looked in ears, nose, throat, listened to lungs. Said I have a viral infection, then asked if I had swab test done. Said yes. He left to check results, came back said they were fine. If I wanted him to prescribe medicine for cold, otherwise over the counter medicine would work. He left room. Tech came back in with a script for Alahist, information on upper respiratory illness with wheezing, walked me to check out. I checked out at 3:15. 2 hours!!! For a 17 minute test, 5 minutes with doctor. Terrible since my husband was sitting in lobby and saw people come in & leave before I came out. The script was useless since pharmacies don't carry that medicine. It would have to be ordered, available on Monday! Pharmacist said to get 3 over the counter medicines that contain what Alahist has in it and take that. Problem is they all have different duration times. Spent night up coughing, no rest. Today I'm still coughing, low grade fever, sore throat, green mucus now. Ribs hurt from the deep coughing, added Tylenol for fever also. 1:45 minutes of being ignored. I will not go back to this facility, nor recommend it to anyone!

name: CORINE JUNE
text: My experience with AFC was totally awesome, front assistance was helpful and professional, I give front office a 10.  My nurse was very knowledgeable, helpful and professional, I give him a 10.  The physician was awesome, he explained eveything to me and was very caring. I give the physician a 10.  AFC was great and I would recommend to others.

name: Michael Maddox
text: Great, friendly, and very hospitable to their patients. Fast service is always key which they have mastered. Great doctors and staff.

name: Riley J Szabo
text: I hadn't intended on posting a review,  but upon receiving a phone call asking me to change my review about their clinic because "it does not reflect them and their service", I feel it is necessary. If you're sick, don't bother going here. I went in at about 11:00 and I was the only patient in the lobby. I signed in and paid my $20 copay the woman at the desk insisted I had to pay, even though my insurance card (which I handed her to look at) says "copay $0"). I am brought back pretty quickly by a nurse who takes my vitals and I have a low grade fever. I get seated and the doctor comes in decently quick, but she is cold and seems to be standoffish. I tell her my symptoms and she looks at my ears, throat, and listens to my breathing. She quickly orders the flu test and walks out. The nurse student says that the test will take about 15 minutes and she swabs my nose. I wait for a total of 48 minutes until some other nurse walks in, hands me a paper that says Influenza Type A on it and tells me to read it. She then walks right back out without seeing if I had questions (which I did!). While I waited, I could hear the nurses and doctors sitting there talking about their lunch plans and weekend plans, not doing their jobs. Also, after about 20 minutes of sitting in the room, I hear the nurses start talking about how my flu test was positive, and they were being super loud about it. That is a HIPPA violation! I then wait another 15 minutes for the student nurse to walk back in and give me my perscriptions and school excuse. Not once did anyone bother to come in and tell me I had the flu and bronchitis or to see if I had any questions. On top of it all, I heard the doctors outside my door arguing about whether or not I could continue to take the Tamiflu with my iron pills, and they still never told me if I should or should not take the Tamiflu and my iron pills. These doctors couldn't even tell me if my medications would conflict or react with the perscriptions they gave me! Overall, my experience was unprofessional, excessively long, and completely rubbish. I will NEVER go back here, and neither should you.

name: Quanda Williams
text: Great staff and didn't keep me waiting longMy provider and the staff were all wonderful.nice,friendly and took care of my needs in a timely manner I would definitely recommend you all to my family and friends

name: Bessie Lucas
text:
I arrived at the east Chase afc on 10/22 for a blood pressure check,  it was very elevated.  The MA was very concerned that i be seen. I spoke to Tiffany Humphrey for a few minute and then signed in. I was having a medication reaction to coreg. Dr. Robinson evaluated me and stop the coreg. Prescribed me losartan. My bp has gone down out of the danger zone. Afc east Chase is great. Thanks staff and
provider.

name: ShaKenya Calhoun
text: Truly recommend this location. The wait time is always minimal. Everyone here was very professional and EXCELLENT bedside manners. Thalia Turniseed is the manager and is doing an oustanding job.

name: Monica Flores
text: Everyone was really nice to me, and the nurse practitioner did a very good job of diagnosing and treating my fever and sore throat. I'm on my way to recovery. Plus, I'm super glad she gave me 3 days to get better. She rocks!

My daughter was very nauseated and feeling terrible the last thing she wanted was to play musical rooms.

text: I came here once 2 years ago and the service was great. I've been back a few times since and it seems it gets worse and worse! The doctor is not friendly, the staff is not friendly, it seems like you are doing them an injustice by being the patient! This will be my last visit here! 3 hours later, still no resolve!

text: The staff was very friendly and welcoming. I really feel I got the best treatment ever!!!

name: Susan Goldthwaite
text: LESS THAN 2 MINUTES WITH THE DOCTOR AND THE WRONG DIAGNOSIS:  I went to AF before closing on a Sunday evening due to a horrible sore throat.  I was quickly taken back as very few people were there.  Once in the back I was swabbed for strep.  When the doctor came, he stated I did not have strep.  He Check my ears, nose, and lungs and told me I had drainage that was making my throat hurt.  He never looked in my throat.  He gave me a steroid shot and a week of amoxicillin. Over the next days I got worse.  After visiting another doctor, it was determined  that I had a bacteria in my esophagus and needed to be treated with a different class of an antibiotic.  Here is my review:  after a $50 co-pay, the doctor spent less than 2 minutes with me, doing a very poor job of considering all the possibilities for my sore throats and just treating me like I had a sinus problem.  He never looked at the back of my throat to see that it was not inflamed and the problem with further down in my esophagus.  I will never go back.  If you choose to use AFC, be sure you get the doctor attention to look at all possibilities as to the cause of your illness.  The doctor is working for you.

name: Ali Sami
text: The worst one ever. Don’t go there. They are damn slow and unprofessional

It seemed like nobody manning the desk knew anything and their phone ediquette was lacking as well. Once I’m done with this workman’s comp claim I will never go back.

name: Charlandra Lee
text: Not a good place to take a toddler. Worst experience ever. I left out and the middle of the service I was receiving crying do to the way Dr. DAVID WILLIAMS handle my daughter. I will be reporting him. No child should never have to ever go through that type of treatment.

name: MIguel Fabricio
text: Terrible! I will never return again. 4 hours to get assistance. It took the receptionist 30 minutes to enter my data on the computer. One of the techs, a tall young man, literally stunk. During my discharge he said he couldn’t remember all the instructions. The lab tech was in training with the xray tech. When I asked the xray tech about her qualitfications for helping the lab tech draw my blood without success, she replied: We are all trained to do all the jobs. The Practicioner precribed 6 different meds in one visit, two days later the MD changed all the drugs. Very confused professionals, not a team to take care of the patient. Professionals seen, lab tech, medical assist, techs, techs, 1 LPN, 1MD one visit. A whole bunch of office assistants just roaming around.
